[tags]: 
Problem with zero epsilon value for Kalman filter

I am coding a Kalman filter in R and I am trying to estimate the parameters dV and dW using the methods as provided in Vignette section2. However I get Epsilon=0 (which is dV for Kalman filter) for my ts data. I am not sure how we get a non-zero dV for the Nile data (available in R) used in the example in 1 . Can somebody explain what dV means as it is not the same as var(z)? > dput(z) # my time series data structure(c(4341, 3426, 2312, 2118, 2003, 1881, 1734, 1764, 1634, 1649, 1316, 1191, 1145, 1094,
